abstract: Booksellers hoping to attract customers and capitalize on worldwide anticipation of long-awaited Harper Lee novel Go Set a Watchman devise read-a-thons, midnight openings, film screenings and other events as substitute for customary promotional appearances since Lee is unwilling and unable to make them.
lead_paragraph: Booksellers are finding creative strategies for drawing in customers for the release of Harper Lee’s second novel, including midnight openings, Southern food and discussion groups.

headline.main: Bookstores Plan Rollout for Next Harper Lee Novel
headline.print_headline: Bookstores Plan Rollout for Next Harper Lee Novel

snippet: Booksellers are finding creative strategies for drawing in customers for the release of Harper Lee’s second novel, including midnight openings, Southern food and discussion groups.
